musicalLanguage.description: Jobim's witty bossa nova about being out of tune is itself a masterclass in sophisticated harmony. The melody deliberately uses chromatic passing tones and altered chord extensions, creating a charming 'slightly off' quality that is actually perfectly calculated. The chord progression moves through diminished and augmented chords with elegant voice leading.
musicalLanguage.structure: A section: Fmaj7 through chromatic descents (4 bars), B section: altered dominants and tritone subs (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bar 1: Fmaj7 — deceptively simple opening before the chromatic adventure.
Bar 3: The Ab diminished passing chord — the 'desafinado' moment.
Bars 5-7: Chain of altered dominants — the harmonic heart of the piece.
teachingGoals: Chromatic voice leading in jazz context
Playing 'wrong' notes that are actually right — altered extensions
styleTips: The chromatic notes should sound deliberate, not accidental
Bossa rhythm stays constant even when harmony gets adventurous
Think of the melody as a singer who knows exactly how 'off' to be

measures.leftHand: F2:q A3 C4 E4:q F2:q A3 C4 E4:q
measures.teachingNote: Fmaj7 — clean opening. Bb is the first chromatic hint.

measures.leftHand: G2:q B3 D4 F4:q G2:q B3 D4 F4:q
measures.teachingNote: G7 — same pattern, down a step. Ab4 is the chromatic spice.

measures.leftHand: Ab2:q B3 D4 F4:q Ab2:q B3 D4 F4:q
measures.teachingNote: Abdim7 — the 'out of tune' moment. Eb against F creates the tension.

measures.leftHand: G2:q Bb3 Db4 E4:q C2:q E3 G3 Bb3:q
measures.teachingNote: G7b9 to C7 — resolution through altered dominant. Complex but beautiful.

measures.leftHand: D2:q F3 A3 C4:q Db2:q F3 Ab3 B3:q
measures.teachingNote: Dm7 to Db7 — tritone substitution. Every note descends chromatically.

measures.leftHand: C2:q E3 G3 Bb3:q C2:q E3 G3 Bb3:q
measures.teachingNote: C7 — melody starts climbing back. The tension wants to resolve.

measures.leftHand: F2:q A3 C4 Eb4:q Bb2:q D3 F3 Ab3:q
measures.teachingNote: F7 to Bbm — another chromatic descent. Every chord has a story.

measures.leftHand: C2:q E3 G3 Bb3:q F2:q A2:q
measures.teachingNote: C7 to F — home at last. The chromatic journey resolves to pure F major.
